intro: Jacquemontia glaucescens var. petiolaris, commonly known as the blue jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces blue to purple blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. This species thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
